Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.21624426]Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=55 µM);Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli (MIC=110 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.21624426]12.8% hemolytic activity at 125 μM against defibrinated horse blood
Sequence Information.Function: Peptide with potent vasoconstrictor properties. Has moderate antimicrobial activity. Not active against fungus C. albicans. Has hemolytic activity against horse erythrocytes.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: Kasstasin is a derivation of Kassina, the taxon of origin, and the Ancient Greek word 'stasis' meaning 'stoppage of flow'.

Literature.Title: Kasstasin A novel potent vasoconstrictor peptide from the skin secretion of the African red-legged running frog, Kassina maculata.
Literature.Author: Li X, Feng W, Zhou M, Ma C, Chen T, Zeller M, Hornshaw M, Wang L, Shaw C.

Literature.Title: Kasstasin: A novel potent vasoconstrictor peptide from the skin secretion of the African red-legged running frog, Kassina maculata
